appendix.title: How to get the latest source from SVN
appendix.para: This page explains how you can get the latest source from the SVN repository and also explains a little bit about the SVN repository.

sect1.title: SVN Repository details
sect1.para: Currently, the main repository is setup, and it's set to readonly (unless you have the right username and password).

If you want read/write access to the repository, please contact pieter@yellowduck.be and he will setup the account for you. You need to have a Berlios account to be able to join the project as a developer. More information can be found on http://developer.berlios.de/.

sect1.title: SVN Repository layout
sect1.para: The layout of the SVN repository follows the standards as for any SVN repository. For each major release (e.g. YDFramework-1.0, YDFramework-2.0), a folder is setup in the SVN repository. For each of these folders, the structure is always the same:

itemizedlist.listitem: trunk: here you will find the very latest version of the source code
tags: here you will find all the released beta and full versions
branches: here you will find milestones and special versions
